page.title: 16LEISURE PURSUITS - S.DOWNS
page.content: The S.Downs is one of the best areas in the S.of England for outdoor exercise & enjoyment. The 80 mls of wide rolling downland & woodland attracts walkers, campers & horse riders, yet it is still possible to walk all day without meeting anyone! Bird watchers, entymologists, botan- ists, archaeologists & conservation- ists find much of interest. Many footpaths & bridleways lead across the Downs & through the forests on the S.side & these are popular with horse riders & walkers. The S.Downs Way is the long distance path from Eastbourne to Buriton. This stretch of downland is hunted by the Cowdray & Leconfield Hunt. Shooting is managed by the Goodwood Estate on the S.& the Cowdray Estate on the N.side of the downs. Forestry marksmen also cull the herds of deer.
